alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Lonoke; Prairie; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 7:14PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Prairie, southern Lonoke, northeastern Grant, northwestern Jefferson, southeastern Saline, southeastern Pulaski and northwestern Arkansas Counties through 745 PM CST... At 713 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wrightsville, or 12 miles southeast of Southwest Little Rock, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Stuttgart... Lonoke... Hazen... Southwest Little Rock... England... Carlisle... Wrightsville... Redfield... Humphrey... Humnoke... Keo... Cane Creek... Ironton... Estes... Toltec Mounds State Park... McCreanor... East End... Orion... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for central and southeastern Arkansas.
